summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center's Legal Department, providing the password for a drive containing discovery materials related to the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which discovery materials are being provided.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The author of the letter, sending the password for discovery materials to the detention center.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the prosecution of Maxwell, as indicated by the case reference and the provision of discovery materials.

events.title: Password Transmission for Discovery
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends the password for a drive containing discovery materials in the Ghislaine Maxwell case to the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is official correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It confirms that discovery materials pertinent to Ghislaine Maxwell were stored on a password-protected drive.
The letter was sent to the legal department of the Metropolitan Detention Center, where Maxwell was likely being held.
Audrey Strauss was the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York as of October 2, 2020.
The document demonstrates the procedural handling of sensitive case materials during the pre-trial phase.
